channel.title: [RELEASE]StormPK/PeeKay with FluxBB Forums
channel.description:
Got life to live, anyway, here's the peekay/stormpk server files, including following applications/tools
[ul][li]RSCD Sprite Editor[/li] [li]XML Compressor[/li] [li]Def Packer[/li] [li]Translated Clients [SWE/FIN][/li] [li]Regular Client[/li] [li]The Server[/li][/ul]
[b]Server features[/b]: -Points system -Ingame control panel -Point trade/stake -Enchanting -Weekend 2x points Some more but i forgot, there not big changes though.
[b]FluxBB RSCD Forums:[/b] - http://www.megaupload.com/?d=N5V8C5JP
[b]StormPK/PeeKay Package[/b] - http://www.megaupload.com/?d=66X05PO5
[b]Database:[/b] - http://www.megaupload.com/?d=IZFXUSI8

item.title: [RELEASE]StormPK/PeeKay with FluxBB Forums
item.dc:creator: @Nemesis1 Nemesis-
item.description:
@Nemesis1 wrote:

[quote=“snoopy89, post:61, topic:330880”]Dos is easy to prevent, atleast when mark gave me the idea to do it from the IP ban system worked very well.

DDoS not sure could work the same but it really depends…
But you can run it from a home computer, because most people actually only attacking from a single IP.

Peopel want a PK server almost everyone I know says it to me every day.[/quote]
Good to hear, ask them what are the most important features in a pk server, and what should pk server be like?

Read full topic

item.title: [RELEASE]StormPK/PeeKay with FluxBB Forums
item.dc:creator: @Nemesis1 Nemesis-
item.description:
@Nemesis1 wrote:

I just can’t see it getting popular, and if it does it will be attacked and messed with so unless you have deep pockets to pay for DDoS migration (or manage some how to get a PK server to pay for itself) I wouldn’t bother. I think people are tired of servers coming and going weekly now, people generally get a reputation for letting their server close and then people don’t ‘trust’ them into wasting time with them any more.

Me neither…yet,

I’ve got some experience in defending from home pc, which is where i’ve hosted all my servers on, All who attacked me were also attacking from Home PC with a simple DoS tool or just ping command
There’s no big botnets around anymore, after Hixk and Tewl quit the scene, there’s only small armies of botnets, talking about less than 100.

And yes, I do know people are tired of new servers, which die in about a week, or less, this ‘Freetimepk’ died in less than a day.
But when server gets popular, I won’t shut it down, Not untill player count is less than five all the time, which happened to PeeKay, and i believe it’s because of the immature community.

I’ve tried to earn some trust and reputation back here to start a new project, which is why i’ve been active on forums lately.

I promise this will be a successful server I’ll do everything to get it popular.

Read full topic

item.title: [RELEASE]StormPK/PeeKay with FluxBB Forums
item.dc:creator: @Nemesis1 Nemesis-
item.description:
@Nemesis1 wrote:

Money involved if you can’t program, sure…

Yes if you can’t, but im sure i will succeed if i get help or start studying.

I still want other peoples opinions, maybe I should make a poll, then again, there’s already a thread about something like this and F2P had pure win.

Read full topic

item.title: [RELEASE]StormPK/PeeKay with FluxBB Forums
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

people would want a point system with forum CP but thta just seems to be impossible unless there money involved.
Dennis also said this forum is only 80% safe so its like a regular rscd forum.

Full f2p Pk only would be a good Pking server, with points and a forum control panel.

Read full topic

item.title: [RELEASE]StormPK/PeeKay with FluxBB Forums
item.dc:creator: @Nemesis1 Nemesis-
item.description:
@Nemesis1 wrote:

Hey everybody, I guess FluxBB deserves a bump, and just so you all know I will continue this project soon, It will turn into F2P server, and xEnt’s script system included, this will allow me to make more NPCs easily and faster, I’ve improved the system slightly.

I have a question to you people,
Point system, or not?

Read full topic

item.title: [RELEASE]StormPK/PeeKay with FluxBB Forums
item.dc:creator: @bengina bengina
item.description:
@bengina wrote:

Anyone got the newest client source? Everything i try(even re-writing the client) just says “client has been updated”… Looked through server files but cant see anything restricting the access… And yes i have looked at the xml conf files server side and the client version client side in all files…

Read full topic

item.title: [RELEASE]StormPK/PeeKay with FluxBB Forums
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

Just need to change the group_id in the users table for user ID 1 to 3 (Guest) IIRC. If you can’t get it working let me TeamViewer. Oh and delete the contents of the cache folder too.

yeh thats pretty much what I did still no success but its old now the foru is only 80% said the my mate.

Read full topic

item.title: [RELEASE]StormPK/PeeKay with FluxBB Forums
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

That’s not all btw

I never figured out how to fix it might want to make a quick Turtorial, I would like to know what I missed when I tryed.

Read full topic

item.title: [RELEASE]StormPK/PeeKay with FluxBB Forums
item.dc:creator: @bengina bengina
item.description:
@bengina wrote:

yea fourms are easy… When in phpmyadmin create a user called test/whatever you want and just make sure to make the id 1… thats it lol, then just edit the files in the www and change the loading adresses to localhost or what ever you run the forums on… then all that needs doing is changing the logout request to load via localhost/what ever you run it on and its done…

As for the client ive changed the version in mudclient,gameWindowMiddleMan and server side but the clients that were released dont work, ive also changed the create socket to localhost and edited the config.java to localhost and still get the message… I think the released clients where old or edited before release… I just dont get why its saying that message… I might just rewrite the client from a standard rscd_v25 client base and see what happens…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Nemesis1 Nemesis-
item.description:
@Nemesis1 wrote:

The_AFKer:

Officer-ahole is right. The way it’s approached is important, simply just saying “it works” doesn’t really say much other than writing inefficient/probably exploitable code. Why would anyone besides a leech want it?

It’s not exploitable.

item.title: [RELEASE]StormPK/PeeKay with FluxBB Forums
item.dc:creator: @Officer-Ahole Officer-Ahole
item.description:
@Officer-Ahole wrote:

[quote=“Nemesis-, post:45, topic:330880”][quote author=Officer-Ahole link=topic=427251.msg3141792#msg3141792 date=1267634440]

Haha okey alright, how would you do it tbh? master.

How would I do it? Much differently that is for sure.

I looked through it, and it’s quite obvious you, or who ever programmed that in, has little experience, and anyone who looks into it will tell you the same.

First, i didnt do it.
I just want to hear how you would do it, so tell me?

Why are you so interested in how I would do it? If I HAD to do it, it would be completely different - My own GUI (not on screen), something separate from the client.

Are you asking me to give you code? I don’t spoon feed anyone.

I think i missunderstood the whole thing, i thought you mean the Points in client, :P.
And no i do not ask to give me your code. lol.

I DID mean the points.

Then what are you asking for - You asked “how would I do it”, the only way I can possibly show you is if I show you the code, and there’s 2 reasons why I’m not going to.

You still dont get it, youre talking about the GUI Points to stats menu, i thought you mean the Points in client.
Points: 500000
get it?
thats why i asked in which way would you do it.

You’re obviously still confused, which is why I suggest you just stop talking. The UI is HOW I would do it differently (the code used and all - Which that is what this conversation really was about; Your programming skills are bad).

Maybe crooks doesn’t have much java knowledge, but then again, he doesn’t need to.

I know its pretty lame to have about 150 lines just to make that point exchange screen, but it’s the easiest way, I didn’t spend much time doing it, because as long as it works, it’s fine.

And there is the problem.
[/quote]
And it doesn’t matter.[/quote]

Now? No, it doesn’t, from what I can tell, it died. However my original point was, it was badly programmed. You’re just using the (typical) “I didn’t spend much time doing it” excuse. My statement wasn’t up for debate and you didn’t need to justify your poorly programmed client. It was a statement, that is all.

Read full topic
